title: The new Hackney plant emporium for shady gardeners
text:
London is in the grip of a late-summer heatwave. Everything green is vaguely crispy; tired buddleia browns over the railway tracks and rooftop sunflowers loll about.

Tucked behind the Hackney Road, though, is an oasis dedicated to beautifying the overlooked pockets of shade that, for many city dwellers, are sold as “gardens”. This is Linda – cool and leafy, a courtyard where foliage hides brick – and London’s first sole purveyor of shade plants for rookie gardeners.

“People will come in here and look around. At first they’ll seem confused, and then they’ll say, ‘Are any of these for inside?’ ” explains one of Linda’s co-founders, Susanna Grant. “We always say, ‘No, but these are so much better’.”...
